recipes.title: Churros con Chocolate

winePairing.pairingText: Churros on the menu? Try pairing with Cream Sherry, Albarino, and Grenache. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. The NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: Very aromatic with notes of hazelnut, vanilla, and a touch of oak followed by sweet raisins and a touch of yeast. Clean lasting finish. Good now but will reward those allow it to age"". A favorite pre-prandial beverage. Consider it with nuts before dinner as an aperitif, or after dinner with dessert, especially chocolates and fruit-based desserts. Also wonderful on cold afternoons, served with biscotti to dip in ""Italian-style"". "

recipes.instructions: On a plate, mix together the sugar and cinnamon (or just sugar if preferable). Set aside.On medium high, heat water, butter and salt to a rolling boil. Stir in flour until mixture thickens. Reduce the heat to medium low and add the flour. Stir until mixture thickens. Remove from heat and add the eggs. Beat until mixture is smooth.Spoon mixture into a Decorator Press using a large star tip (#8B).In a large sauce pan, pour about 1 to 1/2 inches of oil into the pan and heat on medium high to 360 degrees Fahrenheit.Squeeze 4-inch strips of dough into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crunchy, turning once (about 2 minutes on each side).Remove churros and drain on paper towels. Transfer to cinnamon/sugar mixture (or just sugar, if preferable) and roll the churros in sugar until coated. Eat now or make chocolate mixture for dunking!For ChocolateIn a small sauce pan on medium heat, melt the chopped chocolate. Add one cup of milk and stir (should look like chocolate milk!). Mix in the sugar. Dissolve the cornstarch in the remaining milk and add to the chocolate mixture. Continue to stir on medium heat until sauce has thickened. Add extra cornstarch, if needed, if it doesn't start to thicken.Remove from heat, transfer to bowls for Churro dunking! Do not pour over Churros.

steps.step: On a plate, mix together the sugar and cinnamon (or just sugar if preferable). Set aside.On medium high, heat water, butter and salt to a rolling boil. Stir in flour until mixture thickens. Reduce the heat to medium low and add the flour. Stir until mixture thickens.

Remove from heat and add the eggs. Beat until mixture is smooth.Spoon mixture into a Decorator Press using a large star tip (#8B).In a large sauce pan, pour about 1 to 1/2 inches of oil into the pan and heat on medium high to 360 degrees Fahrenheit.Squeeze 4-inch strips of dough into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and crunchy, turning once (about 2 minutes on each side).
Remove churros and drain on paper towels.
Transfer to cinnamon/sugar mixture (or just sugar, if preferable) and roll the churros in sugar until coated. Eat now or make chocolate mixture for dunking!For Chocolate
In a small sauce pan on medium heat, melt the chopped chocolate.
Add one cup of milk and stir (should look like chocolate milk!).
Mix in the sugar. Dissolve the cornstarch in the remaining milk and add to the chocolate mixture. Continue to stir on medium heat until sauce has thickened.
Add extra cornstarch, if needed, if it doesn't start to thicken.
Remove from heat, transfer to bowls for Churro dunking! Do not pour over Churros.
